column.description: A standardized name assigned to an individual mAb or a mixture of mAbs.

A label (MAb name) assigned to an individual mAb or a mixture of mAbs to distinguish them from MAbs/mixtures with the same standardized name, e.g. when mAbs with the same standardized name are compared within a study.

table.description: Metadata table for both NAb and NAb MAb

column.description: Unique ID assigned to the assay for tracking purposes
Unique ID assigned to antigen by DataSpace team
Standard, descriptive full name of antigen
Standard, abbreviated name of antigen
Recommended label/name of antigen for use in plots and publications
Alternate or common names (from submitted data, publications, etc.)
DNA construct ID assigned for Montefiori Lab Plasmid Database.
Concatenation of the elements of the antigen type
Classification which indicates whether the antigen is a recombinant protein, synthetic peptide, or virus.
Region of virus (or antibody) covered
Specific scaffolding applied to the protein
Deviation from natural protein
Specific peptide sequence attached to the protein
Indicates additional distinctions needed to identify unique antigen type e.g. different provider of protein
Indicates if antigen is a control
Concatenation of the elements of the isolate name
Classification for isolate species using informal taxonomy
Unique ID assigned to the isolate donor
Indicates additional distinctions needed to identify unique isolates from the same donor, e.g. visits or specimen types
Clade (gene subtype) to which the isolate is most closely aligned
Identifier assigned to indicate specific isolate clone
Indicates specific mutations to the isolate
Name of the investigator who cloned the isolate
Country of origin of the isolate donor
Year the isolate was isolated
Classification for staging early HIV infection based on test results for markers of the virus and the immune response
Unique identifier assigned to the amino acid sequence for the isolate
Concatenation of production-related elements
Host cell used to incubate the isolate stock during production process
Production process performed to purify the protein
Specific reagent used during production of protein
Lab or commercial facility where antigen produced
Indicates if codon optimization was performed during production
Indicates stable transfection vs transient
Classification of transmitter/founder status of the isolate
